definitions.usage_note: 形容人、感情、意图等真实无伪、发自内心。

sentences.en: Please accept my sincere apologies for the inconvenience.
sentences.zh: 请接受我对给您带来不便的诚挚歉意。

sentences.en: She gave a sincere smile when she heard the good news.
sentences.zh: 听到好消息时，她露出了真诚的微笑。

sentences.en: I have sincere respect for his achievements.
Please accept our sincere thanks for your support.
sentences.zh: 请接受我们对您支持的诚挚感谢。

sentences.en: I offer my sincere apologies for the delay.
sentences.zh: 我为延误致以诚挚的歉意。

genuine.diffs: genuine 强调非伪造、真实；sincere 更侧重情感或意图的真诚

sentences.en: She showed genuine concern for his welfare.
sentences.zh: 她对他的处境表现出真切的关心。

etymology.origin: 来自拉丁语 sincerus，意为“干净的、纯粹的、未掺假的”。有说法认为源自 sine（无）+ cera（蜡），即“无蜡的”，指未用蜡修补过的；另有说法认为源自单一词根。
affixes: 无典型前缀后缀，为词根词
etymology.history: sincerus 原指物质上的纯净，后引申为情感、意图上的真实无伪，即“真诚”。

sentences.en: I sincerely hope you will recover soon.
sentences.zh: 我衷心希望你早日康复。

sentences.en: I doubt his sincerity in making that promise.
sentences.zh: 我怀疑他做出那个承诺的诚意。

common_mistakes.wrong: I am sincere to help you
common_mistakes.correct: I sincerely want to help you / I am sincere in my desire to help you
common_mistakes.explain: sincere 是形容词，不接不定式；表“真诚想做某事”用 sincerely want to do 或 be sincere in one's desire to do。

mnemonics.content: 拉丁语 sincerus（纯净的）→ 心灵纯净、无伪装 → 真诚。可与 since 区分：sincere 强调“真心”。
